Description: Rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery lekanis lid. Underside glazed save for under surface of flange; egg pattern on outside of flange below two glaze lines; on top, much of body and left arm of female standing to right, wearing girded peplos; vertical to right probably the stem of a thyrsus held in her left hand.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2150)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p. 13, pl. 30, 12)
